alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 10:56AM CDT until August 10 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Colbert County in northwestern Alabama... Central Lauderdale County in northwestern Alabama... * Until 200 PM CDT. * At 1056 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across central portions of Colbert and Lauderdale Counties. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 to 45 minutes, and urban runoff will enhance the possibility of flash flooding in these areas around Florence. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Florence, Muscle Shoals, Sheffield, Tuscumbia, Killen, St. Florian, Underwood-Petersville, Oakland and Pride Landing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
